alert.note: Alert for Lewis (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 08 at 3:06AM PST until January 09 at 10:24AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Chehalis River At Centralia affecting Lewis County. .Little rain is in the forecast for the weekend. The Chehalis River at Centralia crested late Friday evening. The river will recede through the weekend falling below flood stage late tonight. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Chehalis River At Centralia. * WHEN...Until Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 173.5 feet, the Chehalis River in Lewis County will cause moderate flooding including Fort Borst Park...residential and commercial areas...farms...and many roads from Chehalis to Centralia. Flood waters begin to inundate SR 6...I-5 ramps at SR 6...Main St Chehalis...and around Plummers and Hayes Lakes. Swift flood waters will cover some roads. This stage corresponds roughly to a Phase 2 flood in the Lewis County flood system. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 AM PST Saturday the stage was 174.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The river crested around 174.9 feet at 11 PM Friday. - Forecast...The river will continue receding today and is expected to fall below flood stage late tonight. The river will keep receding Sunday. - Flood stage is 168.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this morning at 1115 AM PST.
